content: Credit Card CIMB Visa Signature Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 May 2019What would be a good substitute for CIMB Visa signature?With the new CIMB Visa signature T&C, the credit card is not attractive anymore. Does anyone have any suggestion on which credit card on the market that is closely related and suitable to the spending options that CIMB Visa Signature gave?2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 13 May 2019Possible solutions:
https://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2019/05/goodbye-cimb-heres-next-best-credit.html CIMB Visa Signature basically offers dining, online, groceries.There's no single card with around $600 min spend of these 3 category hit with 1 of the 3 taking the bulk.You'll have to split between different card.0 comments1

TWTay WenHaoLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hi. Im also looking for a replacement. Seems like CIMB really offered a good deal of 10%. Cant seem to find anything thats close to it.My best alternative so far is UOB ONE @ 5% for $2000/mth (quite hard to reach but should be okay if I include all my household bills: utilities and telco etc)I'm also using DBS Livefresh currently for paywaves/online. Also 5% (min $600)Hope to hear better alternatives from others too1 comment1

R.Rasyad .12 May 2019That's true, nothing in the market is as attractive as the previous CIMB Visa signature, in regards to its minimum spend and categories, for cashback.

Maybe it's time to look into reward-based credit cards, since most don't have the minimum spend criteria.
